Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior is grooved and dusted with a light-brown deposit, the exterior bears traces of a light-brown slip and faint traces of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394433) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394433)
